description.zh-cn: 一份总部设在纽约的美国报纸，创办于1851年，其影响力和读者群覆盖全球。
description.en: An American newspaper based in New York City with worldwide influence and readership, founded in 1851.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》的联合创始人。
description.en: Co-founder of The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》的联合创始人，后接替亨利·雷蒙德担任发行人。
description.en: Co-founder of The New York Times, who later succeeded Henry Raymond as publisher.

description.zh-cn: 拥有《纽约时报》的美国上市公司，自1896年以来一直由索尔兹伯格家族控制。
description.en: The American publicly traded company that owns The New York Times, controlled by the Sulzberger family since 1896.

nodes.id: 阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格

zh-cn: 阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》的现任出版人，索尔兹伯格家族第五代成员。
description.en: The current publisher of The New York Times, and a fifth-generation member of the Sulzberger family.

zh-cn: 小阿瑟·奥茨·索尔兹伯格

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》前出版人及纽约时报公司董事长，阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格的父亲。
description.en: Former publisher of The New York Times and chairman of The New York Times Company, father of A. G. Sulzberger.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》第四代发行人，小阿瑟·苏兹伯格的父亲。
description.en: The fourth-generation publisher of The New York Times, father of Arthur Ochs Sulzberger Jr.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约每日时报》的初始发行公司。
description.en: The initial publishing company for The New-York Daily Times.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪纽约市民主党领导人，其腐败集团因《纽约时报》的揭露而下台。
description.en: A 19th-century Democratic Party leader in New York City whose corrupt group was brought down by exposés in The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 一个在纽约市的政治组织，在威廉·特威德领导下因腐败而闻名，后被《纽约时报》揭露。
description.en: A New York City political organization, known for corruption under William M. Tweed, which was later exposed by The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 美国总统，在1884年总统选举中获得《纽约时报》的支持。
description.en: President of the United States, who was supported by The New York Times in the 1884 presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 于1896年收购了《纽约时报》，并提出了“所有值得印刷的新闻”的格言。
description.en: Acquired The New York Times in 1896 and coined its slogan, "All the News That's Fit to Print."

description.zh-cn: 一份关于美国在越南战争中参与情况的绝密国防部历史文件，《纽约时报》参与了其曝光。
description.en: A top-secret Department of Defense history of the United States' political and military involvement in Vietnam, which The New York Times helped to expose.

en: New York Times Co. v. Sullivan

description.zh-cn: 一个具有里程碑意义的美国最高法院案件，确立了“真实恶意”标准，以保护言论和新闻自由。
description.en: A landmark U.S. Supreme Court case that established the "actual malice" standard to protect freedom of speech and the press.

en: The New York Times Chinese Website

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》的中文版网站，旨在向中文读者介绍其作品。
description.en: The Chinese-language version of The New York Times' website, aimed at introducing its works to Chinese readers.

description.zh-cn: 英国媒体高管，曾任BBC总裁，后于2012年被任命为《纽约时报》执行总裁。
description.en: A British media executive, former Director-General of the BBC, who was appointed CEO of The New York Times in 2012.

description.zh-cn: 英国广播公司，英国的国家广播机构。
description.en: The British Broadcasting Corporation, the national broadcaster of the United Kingdom.

description.zh-cn: 美国第45任及第47任总统，曾多次批评《纽约时报》为“假新闻”。
description.en: The 45th and 47th President of the United States, who has repeatedly criticized The New York Times as "fake news."

description.zh-cn: 美国联邦法官，曾指责《纽约时报》是民主党的喉舌。
description.en: An American federal judge who accused The New York Times of being a mouthpiece for the Democratic Party.

description.zh-cn: 企业家和商业巨头，曾批评《纽约时报》是“极左派洗脑”。
description.en: An entrepreneur and business magnate who has criticized The New York Times as "far-left brainwashing."

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》驻莫斯科记者，因其对乌克兰大饥荒的报道而备受争议，其报道否认了饥荒的发生。
description.en: The Moscow correspondent for The New York Times, controversial for his reporting on the Holodomor which denied the occurrence of the famine.

description.zh-cn: 1932年至1933年间在乌克兰发生的人为大饥荒，导致数百万人死亡。
description.en: A man-made famine in Ukraine from 1932 to 1933 that killed millions.

description.zh-cn: 苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟，一个存在于1922年至1991年的欧亚大陆社会主义国家。
description.en: The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, a socialist state in Eurasia that existed from 1922 to 1991.

description.zh-cn: 英国记者，因报道1933年苏联乌克兰大饥荒的真相而闻名。
description.en: A Welsh journalist known for reporting the truth of the Holodomor in Ukraine in 1933.

description.zh-cn: 苏联的内政部门，据称谋杀了记者加雷斯·琼斯。
description.en: The interior ministry of the Soviet Union, alleged to have murdered journalist Gareth Jones.

description.zh-cn: 前《纽约时报》记者，因新闻造假和抄袭丑闻于2003年辞职。
description.en: A former journalist for The New York Times who resigned in 2003 due to a scandal involving journalistic fraud and plagiarism.

description.zh-cn: 一场始于2003年的长期武装冲突，美国领导的联军入侵伊拉克，推翻了萨达姆·侯赛因政府。
description.en: A protracted armed conflict that began in 2003 with the invasion of Iraq by a United States-led coalition that overthrew the government of Saddam Hussein.

description.zh-cn: 指能在很大范围内造成破坏和伤亡的武器，伊拉克被错误地认为拥有此类武器是2003年入侵的理由之一。
description.en: A weapon that can cause widespread destruction and casualties. The mistaken belief that Iraq possessed such weapons was a justification for the 2003 invasion.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国外交部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国外交部
en: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政府负责外交事务的部门。
description.en: The government department of the People's Republic of China responsible for foreign affairs.

nodes.id: 纽约时报报道温家宝家族财富事件

zh-cn: 纽约时报报道温家宝家族财富事件
en: New York Times report on Wen Jiabao family wealth

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》于2012年发表的一篇调查性报道，揭露了时任中国总理温家宝家族成员累积的巨额财富，导致其网站在中国大陆被封锁。
description.en: An investigative report published by The New York Times in 2012 detailing the vast wealth accumulated by the family members of then-Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao, which led to the blocking of its website in mainland China.

description.zh-cn: 中国大陆互联网审查系统的通称，用于屏蔽和过滤当局认为不当的互联网内容，曾多次屏蔽《纽约时报》网站。
description.en: The common name for the internet censorship system in mainland China, used to block and filter internet content deemed inappropriate by the authorities. It has blocked The New York Times website on multiple occasions.

description.zh-cn: 美国跨国科技公司，于2016年底在中国区的App Store下架了《纽约时报》的应用。
description.en: An American multinational technology company that removed The New York Times apps from its App Store in China in late 2016.

description.zh-cn: 关于在中国发生的非自愿器官摘取行为的争议，《纽约时报》被指控对此进行自我审查。
description.en: The controversy surrounding non-consensual organ harvesting in China, which The New York Times has been accused of self-censoring.

description.zh-cn: 1851年9月18日，亨利·贾维斯·雷蒙德与乔治·琼斯共同创立了《纽约每日时报》（《纽约时报》前身）。
description.en: On September 18, 1851, Henry Jarvis Raymond co-founded 'The New-York Daily Times' (the original name of The New York Times) with George Jones.

description.zh-cn: 1851年9月18日，乔治·琼斯与亨利·贾维斯·雷蒙德共同创立了《纽约每日时报》（《纽约时报》前身）。
description.en: On September 18, 1851, George Jones co-founded 'The New-York Daily Times' (the original name of The New York Times) with Henry Jarvis Raymond.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约每日时报》最初由雷蒙德琼斯公司负责发行。
description.en: The New-York Daily Times was initially published by Raymond, Jones & Company.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》隶属于上市公司纽约时报公司。
description.en: The New York Times is owned by the publicly traded The New York Times Company.

description.zh-cn: 于1896年收购了濒于破产的《纽约时报》，振兴了该报。
description.en: Acquired the financially failing New York Times in 1896 and revitalized the paper.

description.zh-cn: 担任《纽约时报》第四代发行人。
description.en: Served as the fourth-generation publisher of The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 小阿瑟·苏兹伯格是阿瑟·奥茨·索尔兹伯格（人称“彭区”）的儿子。
description.en: Arthur Ochs Sulzberger Jr. is the son of Arthur Ochs Sulzberger (known as "Punch").

description.zh-cn: 于1992年接替其父成为《纽约时报》第五任发行人。
description.en: Succeeded his father in 1992 to become the fifth publisher of The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 担任纽约时报公司董事长。
description.en: Serves as the Chairman of The New York Times Company.

relationships.source: 阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格

description.zh-cn: 阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格是小阿瑟·苏兹伯格的儿子。
description.en: A. G. Sulzberger is the son of Arthur Ochs Sulzberger Jr.

relationships.source: 阿瑟·格瑞格·索尔兹伯格

description.zh-cn: 担任《纽约时报》的现任出版人。
description.en: Serves as the current publisher of The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 在亨利·雷蒙德于1869年去世后，接任《纽约时报》发行人。
description.en: Took over as publisher of The New York Times after the death of Henry Raymond in 1869.

description.zh-cn: 在1870至1871年间发表了一系列揭露报道，导致威廉·特威德及其腐败集团下台。
description.en: Published a series of exposés between 1870 and 1871 that led to the downfall of William M. Tweed and his corrupt group.

description.zh-cn: 在1870至1871年间发表的揭露报道，导致威廉·特威德领导的坦慕尼协会腐败集团下台。
description.en: Its exposés published between 1870 and 1871 led to the downfall of the corrupt Tammany Hall machine led by William M. Tweed.

description.zh-cn: 在1884年美国总统选举中，宣布支持民主党候选人[[格罗弗·克利夫兰]]。
description.en: In the 1884 United States presidential election, the paper announced its support for Democratic candidate Grover Cleveland.

description.zh-cn: 在20世纪60年代参与曝光了“五角大楼文件”。
description.en: Participated in the exposure of the "Pentagon Papers" in the 1960s.

description.zh-cn: 《纽约时报》在该案中胜诉，确立了“真实恶意”原则，极大地保护了新闻自由。
description.en: The New York Times won the case, which established the "actual malice" principle, greatly protecting freedom of the press.

description.zh-cn: 该报于2004年承认其在伊拉克战争爆发前的报道促进了公众对伊拉克拥有大规模杀伤性武器的误信，从而助长了战争的发生。
description.en: The paper admitted in 2004 that its reporting before the Iraq War promoted the mistaken belief that Iraq possessed weapons of mass destruction, thereby contributing to the push for war.

description.zh-cn: 于2012年6月28日正式上线其官方中文网站。
description.en: Officially launched its Chinese-language website on June 28, 2012.

relationships.target: 纽约时报报道温家宝家族财富事件

description.zh-cn: 刊登了题为《总理家人的隐秘财富》的调查报道。
description.en: Published the investigative report titled "China's Princelings' Hidden Fortunes."

description.zh-cn: 于2012年8月14日被任命为《纽约时报》新任执行总裁。
description.en: Was appointed as the new Chief Executive Officer of The New York Times on August 14, 2012.

description.zh-cn: 在被任命为《纽约时报》执行总裁前，曾担任BBC总裁。
description.en: Served as Director-General of the BBC before being appointed CEO of The New York Times.

description.zh-cn: 多次公开批评《纽约时报》为“假新闻”，并于2018年向其颁发自设的“假新闻奖”。
description.en: Repeatedly and publicly criticized The New York Times as "fake news" and presented it with his self-created "Fake News Award" in 2018.

description.zh-cn: 在一份不同意见书中指责《纽约时报》是“民主党大报”，主要被用作民主党的喉舌。
description.en: In a dissenting opinion, accused The New York Times of being a "Democratic Party broadsheet" primarily used as a mouthpiece for the party.

description.zh-cn: 批评《纽约时报》的堕落，并称其为“极左派洗脑”。
description.en: Criticized the decline of The New York Times, calling it "far-left brainwashing."

description.zh-cn: 因其驻苏联记者沃特·杜兰蒂协助苏联当局否认发生乌克兰大饥荒而备受批评。
description.en: Was heavily criticized because its Soviet correspondent, Walter Duranty, assisted Soviet authorities in denying the occurrence of the Holodomor.

description.zh-cn: 作为《纽约时报》驻莫斯科记者，在报道中否认乌克兰大饥荒的发生，称其为“夸张或恶意宣传”。
description.en: As the Moscow correspondent for The New York Times, he denied the existence of the Holodomor in his reports, calling it an "exaggeration or malignant propaganda."

description.zh-cn: 攻击并试图诋毁记者加雷斯·琼斯关于乌克兰大饥荒的亲眼证词。
description.en: Attacked and attempted to discredit journalist Gareth Jones's eyewitness testimony about the Holodomor.

description.zh-cn: 据称于1935年在蒙古谋杀了正在进行调查的记者加雷斯·琼斯。
description.en: Allegedly murdered journalist Gareth Jones in Mongolia in 1935 while he was conducting an investigation.

description.zh-cn: 其多年的新闻造假行为被曝光后，导致《纽约时报》声誉受损，该报称此事件为其历史上的一个低点。
description.en: His years of journalistic fraud, once exposed, damaged the reputation of The New York Times, which called the incident a low point in its history.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国外交部

description.zh-cn: 作为对美方措施的反制，要求《纽约时报》等5家美国媒体申报信息，并驱逐其部分美籍记者。
description.en: As a countermeasure to US actions, it required The New York Times and four other US media outlets to declare information and expelled some of their American journalists.

description.zh-cn: 在其网站刊登有关温家宝家族财富的文章后，纽约时报的网站在中国大陆被防火长城完全屏蔽。
description.en: After its website published an article about the wealth of Wen Jiabao's family, The New York Times' website was completely blocked by the Great Firewall in mainland China.

description.zh-cn: 于2016年底，根据中国当局的要求，在中国区的App Store下架了《纽约时报》的中英文新闻应用。
description.en: In late 2016, at the request of Chinese authorities, Apple removed the Chinese and English news apps of The New York Times from its App Store in China.

description.zh-cn: 前驻北京记者迪迪．基尔斯滕．塔特洛指控《纽约时报》进行自我审查，压制其关于中共器官摘取的报道。
description.en: Former Beijing correspondent Didi Kirsten Tatlow accused The New York Times of self-censorship by suppressing her reporting on organ harvesting by the CCP.
